nodes.bodyText:
make this method return HiveVersion (then may be static)
this improves flow in getHiveVersion()

can we expect \\. or (\\.|$) after 3rd number? (or how would we parse 3.1.2a3-xyz?)
move to the top
technically, ^ and $ are redundant (you use matcher.matches() anyway)

3.1.2a3-xyz good point (maybe) that would fail of course. Though I did not ever see any letters in version string. returned by metadata (what I saw always looked like this: 3.1.3000.7.1.1.0-565)
Let's address it when we spot it.

the brokenness is specific to Avro, Parquet and binary RCFile (afaict), but not eg to ORC.
so isHiveWithBrokenAvroParquetTimestamps ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -398,17 +398,26 @@ public void testSelectAllDatatypesParquetFile()
                         234.567,
                         new BigDecimal("346"),
                         new BigDecimal("345.67800"),
-                        getHiveVersionMajor() < 3
-                                ? Timestamp.valueOf(LocalDateTime.of(2015, 5, 10, 12, 15, 35, 123_000_000))
+                        isHiveWithBrokenTimestampSemantics()
                                 // TODO (https://github.com/prestosql/presto/issues/1218) requires https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-21002
-                                : Timestamp.valueOf(LocalDateTime.of(2015, 5, 10, 18, 0, 35, 123_000_000)),
+                                ? Timestamp.valueOf(LocalDateTime.of(2015, 5, 10, 18, 0, 35, 123_000_000))
+                                : Timestamp.valueOf(LocalDateTime.of(2015, 5, 10, 12, 15, 35, 123_000_000)),
                         "ala ma kota",
                         "ala ma kot",
                         "ala ma    ",
                         true,
                         "kot binarny".getBytes(UTF_8)));
     }
 
+    private boolean isHiveWithBrokenTimestampSemantics()

nodes.bodyText:
That's not exact.

In 3.1.0 timestamp semantics in hive changed in backward incompatible way

True, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-12192

which was fixed in 3.1.2

portion thereof, not all of it

                         234.567,

-                                ? Timestamp.valueOf(LocalDateTime.of(2015, 5, 10, 12, 15, 35, 123_000_000))
